original: Majjhima Nikāya 65
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Bhaddālisutta
analyzed: bhaddālisutta
translated: With Bhadāli

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Buddha addressed the monks:

original: “bhikkhavo”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti
translated: “Monks!”

original: “Bhadante”ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: bhadanta iti te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ
translated: “Venerable sir,” those monks replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:🔽“Ahaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekāsanabhojanaṁ bhuñjāmi;
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca  aham kho bhikkhave eka āsana bhojanam bhuñjāmi
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: ekāsanabhojanaṁ kho, ahaṁ, bhikkhave, bhuñjamāno appābādhatañca sañjānāmi appātaṅkatañca lahuṭṭhānañca balañca phāsuvihārañca.🔽Etha, tumhepi, bhikkhave, ekāsanabhojanaṁ bhuñjatha;
analyzed: eka āsana bhojanam kho aha bhikkhave bhuñjamānaḥ appa ābādha tañca sañjānāmi appa ātaṅka tañca lahu ṭṭhānañca balañca phāsu vihārañca  tumhe api bhikkhave eka āsana bhojanam bhuñjatha
translated: “Monks, I eat one meal a day, and by doing so I know moderation in eating. I am free from illness and affliction, and I am strong, healthy, and live in comfort.

original: ekāsanabhojanaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tumhepi bhuñjamānā appābādhatañca sañjānissatha appātaṅkatañca lahuṭṭhānañca balañca phāsuvihārañcā”ti.
analyzed: eka āsana bhojanam kho bhikkhave tumhe api bhuñjamānāḥ appa ābādha tañca sañjānissatha appa ātaṅka tañca lahu ṭṭhānañca balañca phāsu vihārañca ati
translated: Come, monks, you too should eat one meal a day. By doing so you will know moderation in eating. You will be free from illness and affliction, and you will be strong, healthy, and live in comfort.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Venerable Bhadāli said to the Buddha:

original: “ahaṁ kho, bhante, na ussahāmi ekāsanabhojanaṁ bhuñjituṁ;
analyzed: aham kho bhante na ussahāmi eka āsana bhojanam bhuñjitu
translated: “I’m not able to eat only one meal a day.

original: ekāsanabhojanañhi me, bhante, bhuñjato siyā kukkuccaṁ, siyā vippaṭisāro”ti.
analyzed: eka āsana bhojanam hi me bhante bhuñjataḥ siyā kukkucca siyā vippaṭisāro ti
translated: If I did, I’d have regrets and misgivings.”

original: “Tena hi tvaṁ, bhaddāli, yattha nimantito assasi tattha ekadesaṁ bhuñjitvā ekadesaṁ nīharitvāpi bhuñjeyyāsi.
analyzed: tena hi tva bhaddāli yattha nimantitaḥ assasi tattha eka desam bhuñjitvā eka desam nīharitvā api bhuñjeyyāsi
translated: “Well then, Bhaddāli, you should eat one part there and take away one part.

original: Evampi kho tvaṁ, bhaddāli, bhuñjamāno ekāsano yāpessasī”ti.
analyzed: evam pi kho tva bhaddāli bhuñjamānaḥ eka āsanaḥ yāpessasi iti
translated: In this way you’ll be able to get by on one meal a day.”

original: “Evampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, na ussahāmi bhuñjituṁ;
analyzed: evam pi kho aha bhante na ussahāmi bhuñjitu
translated: “I’m not able to do that either.

original: evampi hi me, bhante, bhuñjato siyā kukkuccaṁ, siyā vippaṭisāro”ti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavatā sikkhāpade paññāpiyamāne bhikkhusaṅghe sikkhaṁ samādiyamāne anussāhaṁ pavedesi.
analyzed: evam pi hi me bhante bhuñjataḥ siyā kukkucca siyā vippaṭisāro ti  atha kho āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavatā sikkhāpade paññāpiyamāne bhikkhu saṅghe sikkham samādiyamāne anussāham pavedesi
translated: If I did, I’d have regrets and misgivings.”🔽And when the Buddha laid down the training rule, Bhaddāli declared his refusal in the midst of the Sangha of monks.

original: Atha kho āyasmā bhaddāli sabbaṁ taṁ temāsaṁ na bhagavato sammukhībhāvaṁ adāsi, yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya aparipūrakārī.
analyzed: atha kho āyasman bhaddāli sabbam tam temāsam na bhagavato sammukhībhāvam adāsi yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya a paripūra kārī
translated: And for the rest of that three-month period, Bhaddāli did not attend on the Buddha, as one who has not fulfilled the training attends on the Teacher.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: At that time a number of monks were making a robe for the Buddha,

original: niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatīti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā bhaddāli yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti  atha kho āyasmā bhaddāli yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā tehi bhikkhūhi saddhim sammodi
translated: thinking, “When the Buddha’s robe is finished, he’ll go wandering after three months.”🔽Bhaddāli went to those monks and exchanged greetings with them.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ bhaddāliṁ te bhikkhū etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam kho āyasmantam bhaddālim te bhikkhū etat avocuḥ
translated: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down, and they told him what they were doing.

original: “idaṁ kho, āvuso bhaddāli, bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karīyati.
analyzed: idam kho āvuso bhaddāli bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karīyati
translated: “This is the robe that we’re making for the Buddha.

original: Niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissati.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati
translated: When it’s finished, he’ll go wandering after three months.

original: Iṅghāvuso bhaddāli, etaṁ dosakaṁ sādhukaṁ manasi karohi, mā te pacchā dukkarataraṁ ahosī”ti.
analyzed: iṅgha avuso bhaddāli etam dosakam sādhukam manasi karohi mā te pacchā dukkarataram ahosi iti
translated: Please pay attention to this, Bhaddāli, so that it won’t be difficult for you later on.”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā bhaddāli tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho āyasmā bhaddāli tesam bhikkhūnam paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: “Yes, Sirs,” Bhaddāli replied. He then went to the Buddha,

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā
translated: He then went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: bhaddāli bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: bhaddāli bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said,

original: “accayo maṁ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṁ yathāmūḷhaṁ yathāakusalaṁ, yohaṁ bhagavatā sikkhāpade paññāpiyamāne bhikkhusaṅghe sikkhaṁ samādiyamāne anussāhaṁ pavedesiṁ.
analyzed: accayaḥ ma bhante accagamā yathābālam yathāmūḍham yathā akusala yā uham bhagavatā sikkhāpade paññāpiyamāne bhikkhu saṅghe sikkham samādiyamāne anussāham pavedesi
translated: “Venerable Sir, I’ve made a mistake. I’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful in that I expressed my approval when you were teaching the training rules and the monks were undertaking them.

original: Tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṁ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu āyatiṁ saṁvarāyā”ti.
analyzed: tassa me bhante bhagavā accayam accayataḥ paṭiggaṇhātu āyatim savarāya ati
translated: Please accept my confession so that I may restrain myself in the future.”

original: “Taggha tvaṁ, bhaddāli, accayo accagamā yathābālaṁ yathāmūḷhaṁ yathāakusalaṁ, yaṁ tvaṁ mayā sikkhāpade paññāpiyamāne bhikkhusaṅghe sikkhaṁ samādiyamāne anussāhaṁ pavedesi.
analyzed: taggha tva bhaddāli accayaḥ acca gamāḥ yathābālam yathāmūḍham yathāakusala yam tvam mayā sikkhāpade paññāpiyamāne bhikkhu saṅghe sikkham samādiyamāne anussāham pavedesi
translated: “Indeed, Bhaddāli, you have made a mistake. You’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful in that you expressed your approval when I was teaching the training rules and the monks were undertaking them.

original: Samayopi kho te, bhaddāli, appaṭividdho ahosi:
analyzed: samayaḥ api kho te bhaddāli appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi
translated: But you also didn’t realize that

original: ‘bhagavā kho sāvatthiyaṁ viharati, bhagavāpi maṁ jānissati—
analyzed: bhagavā kho sāvatthiyam viharati bhagavā api mama jānissati
translated: the Buddha is staying at Sāvatthī, and he will know that

original: bhaddāli nāma bhikkhu satthusāsane sikkhāya aparipūrakārī’ti.
analyzed: bhaddāli nāma bhikkhu satthu sāsane sikkhāya a paripūra kārī iti
translated: the monk named Bhaddāli is not fulfilling the training in the Teacher’s instruction.”

original: Ayampi kho te, bhaddāli, samayo appaṭividdho ahosi.
analyzed: ayam pi kho te bhaddāli samayaḥ appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi
translated: This was also a time you didn’t declare.

original: Samayopi kho te, bhaddāli, appaṭividdho ahosi:🔽‘sambahulā kho bhikkhū sāvatthiyaṁ vassaṁ upagatā, tepi maṁ jānissanti—
analyzed: samayaḥ api kho te bhaddāli appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi  sambahulā kho bhikkhū sāvatthiyam vassam upagatā te pi mam jānissanti
translated: You also didn’t declare the time

original: bhaddāli nāma bhikkhu satthusāsane sikkhāya aparipūrakārī’ti.
analyzed: bhaddāli nāma bhikkhu satthu sāsane sikkhāya a paripūra kārī iti
translated: when you thought, ‘There are many monks who have entered the rainy-season residence at Sāvatthī. They will know that I’m not fulfilling the training in the Teacher’s instructions.

original: Ayampi kho te, bhaddāli, samayo appaṭividdho ahosi.
analyzed: ayam pi kho te bhaddāli samayaḥ appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi
translated: This was also a time you didn’t declare.

original: Samayopi kho te, bhaddāli, appaṭividdho ahosi:🔽‘sambahulā kho bhikkhuniyo sāvatthiyaṁ vassaṁ upagatā, tāpi maṁ jānissanti—
analyzed: samayaḥ api kho te bhaddāli appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi  sambahulāḥ kho bhikkhuniyaḥ sāvatthiyam vassam upagatāḥ tāḥ api mam jānissanti
translated: You also didn’t declare the time

original: bhaddāli nāma bhikkhu satthusāsane sikkhāya aparipūrakārī’ti.
analyzed: bhaddāli nāma bhikkhu satthu sāsane sikkhāya a paripūra kārī iti
translated: when you thought, ‘There are many nuns who have entered the rainy-season residence at Sāvatthī. They will know that I’m not fulfilling the training in the Teacher’s instructions.

original: Ayampi kho te, bhaddāli, samayo appaṭividdho ahosi.
analyzed: ayam pi kho te bhaddāli samayaḥ appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi
translated: This was also a time you didn’t declare.

original: Samayopi kho te, bhaddāli, appaṭividdho ahosi:🔽‘sambahulā kho upāsakā sāvatthiyaṁ paṭivasanti, tepi maṁ jānissanti—
analyzed: samayaḥ api kho te bhaddāli appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi  sambahulā kho upāsakā sāvatthiyam paṭivasanti te pi mam jānissanti

analyzed: ayam pi kho te bhaddāli samayaḥ appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi
translated: This was a time you didn’t foresee.

translated: You also didn’t foresee this:

original: bhaddāli nāma bhikkhu satthusāsane sikkhāya aparipūrakārī’ti.
analyzed: bhaddāli nāma bhikkhu satthu sāsane sikkhāya a paripūra kārī iti
translated: ‘There are many female lay followers living in Sāvatthī. They will know that I’m not fulfilling the training in the Teacher’s instructions.’

original: Ayampi kho te, bhaddāli, samayo appaṭividdho ahosi.
analyzed: ayam pi kho te bhaddāli samayaḥ appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi
translated: This was a time you didn’t foresee.

original: Samayopi kho te, bhaddāli, appaṭividdho ahosi:🔽‘sambahulā kho nānātitthiyā samaṇabrāhmaṇā sāvatthiyaṁ vassaṁ upagatā, tepi maṁ jānissanti—
analyzed: samayaḥ api kho te bhaddāli appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi  sambahulā kho nānā titthiyā samaṇa brāhmaṇā sāvatthiyam vassam upagatā te api mam jānissanti
translated: You also didn’t foresee this:

original: Ayampi kho te, bhaddāli, samayo appaṭividdho ahosī”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho te bhaddāli samayaḥ appaṭividdhaḥ ahosi iti
translated: This was a time you didn’t foresee.”

translated: “Indeed, Bhaddāli, you have committed an offense. You have been foolish, confused, and unskillful in declaring your approval when I was laying down training rules for the monks.

analyzed: naḥ heta bhante

translated: “What do you think, Bhaddāli?

translated: a Dhamma follower …🔽a faith follower.

analyzed: ehi me tva bhikkhu paṅke saṅkamaḥ hohi iti api nu kho so saṅkameyya vā aññena vā kāyam sannāmeyya no ti vā vadeyya ati

translated: “Yes, Venerable Sir.”🔽“Good, good, Bhaddāli!

translated: Please accept this confession so that I may restrain myself in the future.”

analyzed: taggha tva bhaddāli accayaḥ acca gamāḥ yathābālam yathāmūḍham yathāakusala yam tvam mayā sikkhāpade paññāpiyamāne bhikkhu saṅghe sikkham samādiyamāne anussāham pavedesi
translated: “Indeed, Bhaddāli, you have made a mistake. You’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful in declaring your approval when I was laying down the training rules and the monks were undertaking them.

original: Yato ca kho tvaṁ, bhaddāli, accayaṁ accayato disvā yathādhammaṁ paṭikarosi, taṁ te mayaṁ paṭiggaṇhāma.
analyzed: yatas ca kho tva bhaddāli accayam accayataḥ disvā yathādhammam paṭikarosi tam te mayam paṭiggaṇhāma
translated: But since you now see your mistake and make proper amends, we accept your confession.

original: Vuddhihesā, bhaddāli, ariyassa vinaye yo accayaṁ accayato disvā yathādhammaṁ paṭikaroti, āyatiṁ saṁvaraṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: vuddhi hesā bhaddāli ariyassa vinaye yaḥ accayam accayataḥ disvā yathādhammam paṭikaroti āyatim savaram āpajjati
translated: For it’s growth in the training of the Noble One to see one’s mistake, make proper amends, and undertake restraint for the future.”

original: Idha, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu satthusāsane sikkhāya aparipūrakārī hoti.
analyzed: idha bhaddāli ekaccaḥ bhikkhu satthu sāsane sikkhāya a paripūra kārī hoti
translated: Here, Bhaddali, a bhikkhu does not fulfil the training in the Teacher’s Dispensation.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: He thinks:

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajeyyaṁ araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjaṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham vivittam senāsanam bhajeyyam araññam rukkha mūlam pabbatam kandaram giri guham su sānam vana pattham abbhokāsam palāla puñja
translated: ‘Suppose I were to frequent remote lodgings in the forest…

original: Appeva nāmāhaṁ uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ sacchikareyyan’ti.🔽So vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajati araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjaṁ.🔽Tassa tathāvūpakaṭṭhassa viharato satthāpi upavadati, anuviccapi viññū sabrahmacārī upavadanti, devatāpi upavadanti, attāpi attānaṁ upavadati.
analyzed: appā iva nāma aham uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesam sacchikareyyanti  so vivittam senāsanam bhajati araññam rukkha mūlam pabbatam kandaram giri guham su sānam vana pattham abbhokāsam palāla puñja  tassa tathāvūpakaṭṭhassa viharataḥ satthā api upavadati anuvicca api viññū sabrahmacārī upavadanti devatā api upavadanti attā api attānam upavadati
translated: Perhaps I might realise a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.’🔽He frequents remote lodgings in the forest…🔽But while he is living thus, the Teacher admonishes him, and his wise companions in the holy life admonish him, and the deities also admonish him, and he admonishes himself.

original: So satthārāpi upavadito, anuviccapi viññūhi sabrahmacārīhi upavadito, devatāhipi
analyzed: so satthārā api upavaditaḥ anuvicca api viññūhi sabrahmacārīhi upavaditaḥ devatāhi pi
translated: Admonished by the Teacher, admonished by his wise companions in the holy life, admonished by the deities, and admonishing himself,

original: upavadito, attanāpi attānaṁ upavadito na uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ sacchikaroti.
analyzed: upavaditaḥ attanā api attānam upavaditaḥ na uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesam sacchikaroti
translated: and he criticizes himself for not realizing a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Evañhi taṁ, bhaddāli, hoti yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya aparipūrakārissa.
analyzed: evam hi ta bhaddāli hoti yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya a paripūra kārissa
translated: Because, Bhaddāli, it is the nature of those who do not fulfill the training to be like that.

original: Idha pana, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu satthusāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārī hoti.
analyzed: idha pana bhaddāli ekaccaḥ bhikkhu satthu sāsane sikkhāya paripūra kārī hoti
translated: “Here, Bhaddāli, a bhikkhu fulfills the training in the Teacher’s Dispensation.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: He thinks:

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajeyyaṁ araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjaṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham vivittam senāsanam bhajeyyam araññam rukkha mūlam pabbatam kandaram giri guham su sānam vana pattham abbhokāsam palāla puñja
translated: ‘Suppose I were to frequent remote lodgings in the forest and jungle, in the depths of the jungle, far from the madding crowd, secluded from human beings, unfrequented by people, favourable for retreat.’

original: Appeva nāmāhaṁ uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ sacchikareyyan’ti.
analyzed: appā iva nāma aham uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesam sacchikareyyanti
translated: Perhaps I could realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.’

original: So vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajati araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjaṁ.
analyzed: so vivittam senāsanam bhajati araññam rukkha mūlam pabbatam kandaram giri guham su sānam vana pattham abbhokāsam palāla puñja
translated: He frequents remote lodgings in the forest and jungle, in the depths of the jungle, far from the madding crowd, secluded from human beings, unfrequented by people, favourable for retreat.

original: Tassa tathāvūpakaṭṭhassa viharato satthāpi na upavadati, anuviccapi viññū sabrahmacārī na upavadanti, devatāpi na upavadanti, attāpi attānaṁ na upavadati.
analyzed: tassa tathāvūpakaṭṭhassa viharato satthā api na upavadati anuvicca api viññū sabrahmacārī na upavadanti devatā api na upavadanti attā api attānam na upavadati
translated: So he is spoken to by the Teacher or by a respectable companion in the holy life, he doesn’t misconstrue his words, doesn’t misapprehend them, doesn’t get upset, doesn’t display anger or irritation or loathing.

original: So satthārāpi anupavadito, anuviccapi viññūhi sabrahmacārīhi anupavadito, devatāhipi🔽anupavadito, attanāpi attānaṁ anupavadito uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ sacchikaroti.
analyzed: so satthārā api an upavaditaḥ anuvicca api viññūhi sabrahmacārīhi an upavaditaḥ devatāhi pi  an upavaditaḥ attanā api attānam an upavaditaḥ uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesam sacchikaroti
translated: He realizes a superhuman distinction in knowledge & vision worthy of the noble ones.

original: So vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: saḥ vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: Quite secluded from sensuality, secluded from unskillful qualities, he enters & remains in the first jhāna: rapture & pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by directed thought & evaluation.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Evañhi taṁ, bhaddāli, hoti yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa.
analyzed: evam hi ta bhaddāli hoti yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa
translated: Because it’s in this way that the training of the Teacher’s message is fulfilled.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhaddāli, bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: puna capara bhaddāli bhikkhu vitakka vicārānam vūpasamā ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: “Again, with the stilling of applied and sustained thought, a bhikkhu enters upon and abides in the second jhana…

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: Evañhi taṁ, bhaddāli, hoti yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhaddāli, bhikkhu pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno🔽sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedeti, yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti
analyzed: evam hi ta bhaddāli hoti yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa  puna capara bhaddāli bhikkhu pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sataḥ ca sampajāno  sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedeti yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti upekkhakaḥ satimā sukha vihārī iti
translated: It is because he does so that it is said of such a bhikkhu that he is training in the Teacher’s Dispensation and is fulfilling the Teacher’s Dispensation.

original: tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: “Again, with the fading away as well of rapture, a bhikkhu abides in equanimity, and mindful and fully aware, still feeling pleasure with the body, he enters upon and abides in the third jhana, on account of which noble ones announce: ‘He has a pleasant abiding who has equanimity and is mindful.’

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: Evañhi taṁ, bhaddāli, hoti yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa.
analyzed: evam hi ta bhaddāli hoti yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa
translated: It is because he does so that it is said of such a bhikkhu that he is training in the Teacher’s Dispensation and is fulfilling the Teacher’s Dispensation.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhaddāli, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ
analyzed: puna capara bhaddāli bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassāna
translated: “Again, with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous disappearance of joy and grief, a bhikkhu enters upon and abides in the fourth jhana, which has neither-pain-nor-pleasure and purity of mindfulness due to equanimity.

original: atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: with the complete transcending of perceptions of form, with the disappearance of perceptions of sensory impingement, with non-attention to perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite,’ he enters & remains in the dimension of the infinitude of space.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Evañhi taṁ, bhaddāli, hoti yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa.
analyzed: evam hi ta bhaddāli hoti yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa
translated: Because it is in this way that the training of the Teacher’s disciples is fulfilled.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti
translated: “When his mind is thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs it to the knowledge of the ending of the effluents.

original: So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.
analyzed: so aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati sa iyyathida ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: He discerns, as it has come to be, that ‘This is stress… This is the origination of stress… This is the cessation of stress… This is the way leading to the cessation of stress… These are effluents… This is the origination of effluents… This is the cessation of effluents… This is the way leading to the cessation of effluents.’

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is in this way that the training of the Teacher’s disciples is fulfilled.”

original: Evañhi taṁ, bhaddāli, hoti yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa.
analyzed: evam hi ta bhaddāli hoti yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa
translated: “And how, lord, is the training of the Teacher’s disciples fulfilled?”

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.🔽So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne🔽hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti: ‘ime vata
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti  so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne  hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti ime vata
translated: When his concentrated mind was purified, bright, unblemished, free of imperfection, malleable, workable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directed it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.🔽With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. He understood how beings pass on according to their actions thus:

original: bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā …pe… vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannā; ime vā
analyzed: bhonto sattā kāya duccaritena samannāgatā pe vinipātam nirayam upapannāḥ ime vā
translated: ‘These worthy beings who are ill-conducted in body, speech, and mind, revilers of noble ones, wrong in their views, giving effect to wrong view, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a state of deprivation, in a bad destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā …pe… sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā’ti
analyzed: pana bhonto sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatā pe sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati
translated: But these worthy beings who are well-conducted in body, speech, and mind, not revilers of noble ones, right in their views, giving effect to right view, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a good destination, even in the heavenly world.’

original: iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena …pe… yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.
analyzed: iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena pe yathā kamma upage satte pajānāti
translated: Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he understood how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is it so?

original: Evañhi taṁ, bhaddāli, hoti yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa.
analyzed: evam hi ta bhaddāli hoti yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa
translated: Because, Bhaddali, it is in such a way that the training of the Teacher’s instruction is fulfilled.”

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti
translated: When his concentrated mind was purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directed it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: So ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: saḥ idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: He understood as it really is: ‘This is suffering’; he understood as it really is: ‘This is the origin of suffering’;

original: ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti;
analyzed: ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati  yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: he understood as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering’; he understood as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: ‘ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ āsavasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,🔽‘ayaṁ āsavanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti
analyzed: ime āsavāḥ ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam āsava samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti  ayam āsava nirodha uti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati
translated: He understood as it really is: ‘These are the taints’; he understood as it really is: ‘This is the origin of the taints’;

original: yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: he understood as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of the taints’; he understood as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints.’

original: Tassa evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati.
analyzed: tassa evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccati bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccati avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccati
translated: When he knew and saw thus, his mind was liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ hoti.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam hoti
translated: When it was liberated there came the knowledge: ‘It is liberated.’

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: He understands: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Evañhi taṁ, bhaddāli, hoti yathā taṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissā”ti.
analyzed: evam hi ta bhaddāli hoti yathā tam satthu sāsane sikkhāya paripūrakārissa ati
translated: Because, Bhaddāli, it is in such a way that you will fulfill the training in the Teacher’s Dispensation.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the venerable Bhaddāli said to the Blessed One:

original: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena midhekaccaṁ bhikkhuṁ pasayha pasayha kāraṇaṁ karonti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekaccam bhikkhum pasayha pasayha kāraṇam karonti
translated: “Venerable sir, what is the reason, what is the cause why they keep on pressing and needling a certain bhikkhu,

original: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena midhekaccaṁ bhikkhuṁ no tathā pasayha pasayha kāraṇaṁ karontī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekaccam bhikkhum no tathā pasayha pasayha kāraṇam karonti iti
translated: and what is the reason, what is the cause why they do not keep on pressing and needling another bhikkhu?”

original: “Idha, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu abhiṇhāpattiko hoti āpattibahulo.
analyzed: idha bhaddāli ekaccaḥ bhikkhu abhiṇhāpattikaḥ hoti āpatti bahulaḥ
translated: “Here, Bhaddāli, a certain bhikkhu is often in an offended state of mind and has a multitude of offences.

original: So bhikkhūhi vuccamāno aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeti, kopañca
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhūhi vuccamānaḥ aññena aññam paṭicarati bahiddhā katham apanāmeti kopam ca
translated: When he is spoken to by the bhikkhus, he answers in a contrary way, he prevaricates, he displays anger,

original: dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti, na sammā vattati, na lomaṁ pāteti, na netthāraṁ

original: āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṁ dhammānaṁ paṭighātāya.
analyzed: āsava ṭṭhānīyānam dhammānam paṭighātāya
translated: But when the Sangha has reached the end of the Rains, then some things that are a basis for taints become manifest in the Sangha. Then the Teacher lays down training rules for his disciples in order to ward off those things that are a basis for taints.

original: Appakā kho tumhe, bhaddāli, tena samayena ahuvattha yadā vo ahaṁ ājānīyasusūpamaṁ dhammapariyāyaṁ desesiṁ.
analyzed: appakā kho tumhe bhaddāli tena samayena ahuvattha yadā vaḥ aham ājānīya su su upamam dhammapariyāyam desesi
translated: Bhaddāli, there were few of you at that time when I taught the Dhamma in the form of the simile of the young thoroughbred colt.

original: Taṁ sarasi bhaddālī”ti?
analyzed: tam sarasi bhaddāli iti
translated: Do you remember that, Bhaddāli?”

original: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: “No, venerable sir.”

original: “Tatra, bhaddāli, kaṁ hetuṁ paccesī”ti?
analyzed: tatra bhaddāli kam hetum paccesi iti
translated: “What do you think, Bhaddāli? What is the reason?”

original: “So hi nūnāhaṁ, bhante, dīgharattaṁ satthusāsane sikkhāya aparipūrakārī ahosin”ti.
analyzed: saḥ hi nūna aha bhante dīgharattam satthu sāsane sikkhāya a paripūra kārī ahosinti
translated: “Venerable sir, it is because for a long time I have been one who does not fulfil the training in the Teacher’s Dispensation.”

original: “Na kho, bhaddāli, eseva hetu, esa paccayo.
analyzed: na kho bhaddāli esa iva hetu esa paccayo
translated: “Bhaddāli, that is not the only reason, that is not the only cause.

original: Api ca me tvaṁ, bhaddāli, dīgharattaṁ cetasā cetoparicca vidito:
analyzed: api ca me bhaddāli dīgharattam cetasā viditaḥ
translated: For a long time, Bhaddāli, I have known you thus:

original: ‘na cāyaṁ moghapuriso mayā dhamme desiyamāne aṭṭhiṁ katvā manasi katvā sabbacetaso samannāharitvā ohitasoto dhammaṁ suṇātī’ti.
analyzed: na ca ayam mogha purisaḥ mayā dhamme desiyamāne aṭṭhim katvā manasi katvā sabba cetasaḥ samannāharitvā ohita sotaḥ dhammam suṇāti iti
translated: ‘This foolish man doesn’t listen to the teaching with eager ears, doesn’t pay attention, doesn’t try to memorize it, doesn’t consider it with the mind, or doesn’t examine it with the wisdom.’

original: Api ca te ahaṁ, bhaddāli, ājānīyasusūpamaṁ dhammapariyāyaṁ desessāmi.
analyzed: api ca te aha bhaddāli ājānīya su sūpamam dhamma pariyāyam desessāmi
translated: But, Bhaddāli, I will teach you the Dhamma by means of the simile of the thoroughbred horse.

original: Taṁ suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and pay careful attention to what I say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, lord,” Ven. Bhaddāli replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhaddāli, dakkho assadamako bhadraṁ assājānīyaṁ labhitvā paṭhameneva mukhādhāne kāraṇaṁ kāreti.🔽Tassa mukhādhāne kāraṇaṁ kāriyamānassa hontiyeva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici, yathā taṁ akāritapubbaṁ kāraṇaṁ kāriyamānassa.
analyzed: sa iyyathā api bhaddāli dakkhaḥ assadamakaḥ bhadram assājānīyam labhitvā paṭhamena iva mukhādhāne kāraṇam kāreti  tassa mukha ādhāne kāraṇam kāriyamānassa hontiyā iva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici yathā tam a kārita pubbam kāraṇam kāriyamānassa
translated: “Bhaddāli, it’s like a skilled horse-trainer who, having obtained a thoroughbred horse, would first make it get used to wearing the bit.🔽While the thoroughbred horse is being made to get used to wearing the bit, it would struggle, kick, rear, and fall over, do anything to get out of it.

original: So abhiṇhakāraṇā anupubbakāraṇā tasmiṁ ṭhāne parinibbāyati.
analyzed: saḥ abhiṇha kāraṇā anupubba kāraṇā tasmin ṭhāne parinibbāyati
translated: But because of the frequent training, the thoroughbred horse would come to be at ease in that posture.

original: Yato kho, bhaddāli, bhadro assājānīyo abhiṇhakāraṇā anupubbakāraṇā tasmiṁ ṭhāne parinibbuto hoti, tamenaṁ assadamako uttari kāraṇaṁ kāreti yugādhāne.
analyzed: yatas kho bhaddāli bhadraḥ assājānīyaḥ abhiṇha kāraṇā anupubba kāraṇā tasmin ṭhāne parinibbutaḥ hoti tam enam assadamakaḥ uttari kāraṇam kāreti yugādhāne
translated: When the fine thoroughbred horse has been completely extinguished in that place through repeated practice and mastery, the horse trainer makes him perform the further task of bearing the yoke.

original: Tassa yugādhāne kāraṇaṁ kāriyamānassa hontiyeva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici, yathā taṁ akāritapubbaṁ kāraṇaṁ kāriyamānassa.
analyzed: tassa yuga ādhāne kāraṇam kāriyamānassa hontiyā iva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici yathā tam a kārita pubbam kāraṇam kāriyamānassa
translated: While he is being made to perform the task of bearing the yoke, there are still some snorts, snorts and soughs, just as there were when he was being made to perform the task that had not been performed before.

original: So abhiṇhakāraṇā anupubbakāraṇā tasmiṁ ṭhāne parinibbāyati.
analyzed: saḥ abhiṇha kāraṇā anupubba kāraṇā tasmin ṭhāne parinibbāyati
translated: But he is completely extinguished in that place through repeated practice and mastery.

original: Yato kho, bhaddāli, bhadro assājānīyo abhiṇhakāraṇā anupubbakāraṇā tasmiṁ ṭhāne parinibbuto🔽hoti, tamenaṁ assadamako uttari kāraṇaṁ kāreti anukkame maṇḍale khurakāse dhāve davatte
analyzed: yatas kho bhaddāli bhadraḥ assājānīyaḥ abhiṇha kāraṇā anupubba kāraṇā tasmin ṭhāne parinibbutaḥ  hoti tam enam assadamakaḥ uttari kāraṇam kāreti anukkame maṇḍale khura kāse dhāve davatte
translated: When the fine thoroughbred horse has been completely extinguished in that place through repeated practice and mastery,

original: rājaguṇe rājavaṁse uttame jave uttame haye uttame sākhalye.
analyzed: rāja guṇe rāja vase uttame jave uttame haye uttame sākhalye
translated: the horse trainer makes him perform the further task of going in a walk, a trot, a canter, a gallop, of going forwards, of going backwards, of turning right about, of turning left about, of kneeling down, of sitting down, and of lying down.

original: Tassa uttame jave uttame haye uttame sākhalye kāraṇaṁ kāriyamānassa hontiyeva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici, yathā taṁ akāritapubbaṁ kāraṇaṁ kāriyamānassa.
analyzed: tassa uttame jave uttame haye uttame sākhalye kāraṇam kāriyamānassa hontiyā iva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici yathā tam a kārita pubbam kāraṇam kāriyamānassa
translated: When he is being made to do what he has never done before, he pants, pants, pants, he sweats, sweats, sweats, he shakes, shakes, shakes.

original: So abhiṇhakāraṇā anupubbakāraṇā tasmiṁ ṭhāne parinibbāyati.
analyzed: saḥ abhiṇha kāraṇā anupubba kāraṇā tasmin ṭhāne parinibbāyati
translated: But because he is repeatedly made to do it, he gradually becomes free from panting, sweating and shaking.

original: Yato kho, bhaddāli, bhadro assājānīyo abhiṇhakāraṇā anupubbakāraṇā tasmiṁ ṭhāne parinibbuto hoti, tamenaṁ assadamako uttari vaṇṇiyañca pāṇiyañca anuppavecchati.
analyzed: yatas kho bhaddāli bhadraḥ assājānīyaḥ abhiṇha kāraṇā anupubba kāraṇā tasmin ṭhāne parinibbutaḥ hoti tam enam assadamakaḥ uttari vaṇṇiyam ca pāṇiyam ca anuppavecchati
translated: When he is free from panting, sweating and shaking, the horse trainer gives him more and more to eat and drink and more and more caresses, strokes and scratches.

original: Imehi kho, bhaddāli, dasahaṅgehi samannāgato bhadro assājānīyo rājāraho hoti rājabhoggo rañño aṅganteva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: imehi kho bhaddāli dasa haṅgehi samannāgataḥ bhadraḥ assa ājānīyaḥ rājā ārahaḥ hoti rāja bhoggaḥ raññaḥ aṅgantā iva saṅkhyam gacchati
translated: “A fine thoroughbred horse endowed with these ten factors is worthy of a king, is the king’s equal, and is reckoned as a factor of a king.

original: Evameva kho, bhaddāli, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassa.
analyzed: evam eva kho bhaddāli dasahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu āhuneyyaḥ hoti pāhuneyyaḥ dakkhiṇeyyaḥ añjali karaṇīyaḥ anuttaram puññakkhettam lokassa
translated: “So too, Bhaddali, a bhikkhu endowed with ten qualities is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutation, an unsurpassed field of merit for the world.

original: Katamehi dasahi?
analyzed: katamehi dasahi
translated: What are the ten?

original: Idha, bhaddāli, bhikkhu asekhāya sammādiṭṭhiyā samannāgato hoti, asekhena sammāsaṅkappena🔽samannāgato hoti, asekhāya sammāvācāya samannāgato hoti, asekhena sammākammantena
analyzed: idha bhaddāli bhikkhu asekhāya sammādiṭṭhiyā samannāgataḥ hoti asekhena sammāsaṅkappena  samannāgataḥ hoti asekhāya sammāvācāya samannāgataḥ hoti asekhena sammākammantena
translated: Here, Bhaddāli, a monk has the right view of one beyond training, the right thought of one beyond training,🔽the right speech of one beyond training, the right action of one beyond training,

original: samannāgato hoti, asekhena sammāājīvena samannāgato hoti, asekhena sammāvāyāmena🔽samannāgato hoti, asekhāya sammāsatiyā samannāgato hoti, asekhena sammāsamādhinā
analyzed: samannāgataḥ hoti asekhena sammāājīvena samannāgataḥ hoti asekhena sammāvāyāmena  samannāgataḥ hoti asekhāya sammā satiyā samannāgataḥ hoti asekhena sammā samādhinā
translated: the right livelihood of one beyond training, the right effort of one beyond training,🔽the right mindfulness of one beyond training, the right concentration of one beyond training,

original: samannāgato hoti, asekhena sammāñāṇena samannāgato hoti, asekhāya sammāvimuttiyā samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: samannāgataḥ hoti asekhena sammāñāṇena samannāgataḥ hoti asekhāya sammāvimuttiyā samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: the right knowledge of one beyond training, and the right freedom of one beyond training.

original: imehi kho, bhaddāli, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassā”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho bhaddāli dasahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu āhuneyyaḥ hoti pāhuneyyaḥ dakkhiṇeyyaḥ añjali karaṇīyaḥ anuttaram puññakkhettam lokassa ati
translated: A monk endowed with these ten qualities is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutations, an unsurpassed field of merit for the world.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: That is what the Blessed One said.

original: Attamano āyasmā bhaddāli bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.🔽Bhaddālisuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: atta manaḥ bhaddāli bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandi iti 🔽bhaddāli suttam niṭṭhitam pañcama
translated: And Ven. Bhaddāli was satisfied and delighted in the Blessed One’s words.
